messages.message:
@Balaram ^^ It is not the problem of `correct_orientation_fine` - it is a problem with our google OCR, somehow it doesnâ€™t handle rotation correctly. We saw this bug during the DHL POC and I thought we fixed it. But seems that the bug reappears.

I set up a test repo here
https://www.instabase.com/ib_solutions/solutions/fs/Instabase%20Drive/poc/Genpact/Inverted_Test/#
the input file is https://www.instabase.com/ib_solutions/solutions/fs/Instabase%20Drive/poc/Genpact/Inverted_Test/samples/input/test.jpg
a up side down file
the output is
https://www.instabase.com/apps/ocr/review-doc/ib_solutions/solutions/fs/Instabase%20Drive/poc/Genpact/Inverted_Test/samples/out/s1_process_files/test.jpg.ibocr?i=0&ibflowresults=
the word `Hilton` appears at the bottom
the flow i use to ocr is
https://www.instabase.com/apps/flow/edit/ib_solutions/solutions/fs/Instabase%20Drive/poc/Genpact/Inverted_Test/workflows/test-invert.ibflow
just google ocr with no special config settings
cc @Jonathan Shih @Aaron Tami
